results.title: End of the line
results.brief_description: This film was shot in a small industrial village, in North West England, called Heap Bridge. The film examines this village, its main industry being papermaking, and its history that goes back to the Industrial Revolution over 150 years ago.

results.title: End of a summers day
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, George Pearson, Don Rennick and Robert Fortier
results.brief_description: A comment without words on the ancient theme of love and war: the man called to arms for his country; his sweetheart left behind to mourn; sorrow and separation visited upon the innocent. This is how it has always been, but implicit in the film are the protests of a new generation: Must it always be so? Is not love better than war? Cast includes: Michel Gauthier, Dennis Nadeau, Caroline Price, Paul Sullivan. (Award: New York)

results.title: End game in Paris
results.creator_credit: Robert Verrall, ONF | NFB and Veronika Soul
results.brief_description: An adaptation of a segment of Ian Adam’s novel ‘End Game in Paris’, this film concerns a man’s search for his double. The man, a freelance photographer recently returned from Saigon, discovers that his life is being threatened. Filmmaker Veronika Soul experiments with sound and image to create a tense, enigmatic drama in which the audience is walked along a thin edge. Camera by Wolf Koenig. (Awards: Yorkton)

results.title: Encyclopaedia galactica
results.creator_credit: Gregory Andorfer, Adrian Malone, Polytel, BBC, Carl Sagan Productions and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Cosmos: a personal voyage”.
In this episode Carl Sagan tackles the question of the possibilities of life on other planets. In spite of the lack of compelling credible evidence that alien visitors have visited our planet, Sagan demonstrates the probability of life existing elsewhere in the universe, and some of the possible forms this life might take. He also discusses the possibility of interstellar communication and how this might be interpreted, using the example of the deciphering of Egyptian hieroglyphics by Jean Francois Champollion, posing the notion that the laws of science are a common language, a kind of Rosetta Stone.

results.title: Encounters with whales
results.creator_credit: Ross Isaacs, Ocean Planet Images and Chris Strewe
results.brief_description: Tina Dalton dedicates this film “to the gentle leviathans of the sea, whose beauty and innocence have awakened me.” Aboard the Tall Ship “Anna Kristina”, a team of scientists and Tina observe and interact with Humpback Whales of Platypus Bay. This video captures rare images of these giants, leaping out of the water in a spectacular display of strength and grace, interacting with Tina in a special show of trust and males fighting for mating supremacy. Share the joy with a team of rescuers as they save a stranded whale.

results.title: Encounters with Islam [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Roger Bayley and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Compass (Television program)”.
This program discusses the aftermath of September 11 and its impact on Australian Muslims who represent just over 1% of the Australian population. Whilst focusing on some of the negative aspects including vilification, violence and antagonism towards women by non-Muslims, vandal attacks on mosques and a media which seemed to be more intent on dividing the community rather than uniting it, “Encounters with Islam” also seeks to reveal a more positive view. Through interviews with various leaders of the Islamic community, academics, young people and non-Muslims, it is apparent that a re-evaluation is taking place amongst the Muslims and a recognition that their world of Islam needs to be demystified and the Australian population informed. The link of crime and acts of terrorism with Muslims stems from not only the tragedy of September 11, but also preceding incidents in Sydney of gang rapes and drug related crimes allegedly by men of Muslim backgrounds. Misunderstanding and prejudice are trying to be counteracted through dialogue and discussion between the different faiths, support, understanding and a “fair go” by the non-Muslim Australian community and a better educated and more sensitive media. Presented by Geraldine Doogue.

results.title: Encounters of the spooky kind
results.creator_credit: Raymond Chow, Bo Ho Films and Samo Hung
results.brief_description: Encounters of the Spooky Kind, directed by icon of kung-fu cinema Samo Hung, has been credited with establishing the unique horror sub-genre of hopping vampire films, most vividly demonstrated by the Mr. Vampire series. A bizarre blend of slapstick, martial arts and the supernatural, this film follows the adventures of Cheung the Brave, an impoverished cart driver plagued by bad luck and a shrewish wife who is conducting an affair with his wealthy boss, Master Tam. After narrowly avoiding being caught one afternoon, Tam resolves to have Cheung eliminated by having a man dare him to spend a night in a haunted temple, and then paying Chin Hoi, a corrupt Taoist sorcerer, to raise a vampire to kill him. Cheung, unable to resist both a dare and the chance to prove his bravery, accepts, but is saved from certain death by his kung-fu skills and the advice of the sorcerer’s brother Tsui, who decides to help him defeat those who were plotting against him. Utilising his superior kung-fu abilities and a variety of vampire deterrents including chicken eggs, uncooked rice and a brew of dog’s legs and blood, he manages to ward off the vampire for a second night, only to be framed for the alleged murder of his wife. Escaping, Cheung finds himself caught up in a feud that eventually culminates in an explosive magical showdown between the warring brothers. As the evil incantations fly, Cheung, possessed by the spirit of the Monkey God, and Master Tam, possessed by the War God, are pitted against each other in a supernatural duel to the death. Stars Samo Hung as Cheung the Brave, Ha Wong as Master Tam, Lung Chan as Chin Hoi, and Fat Chung as Tsui. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Encounter with Saul Alinsky
results.creator_credit: Peter Pearson, John Kemeny, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
Part One of this film shows a lively confrontation between Saul Alinsky a professional activist, from the US whose efforts have been directed toward organising the poor, and several members of the Company of Young Canadians. In Part Two some young articulate Indians test their inherently tolerant philosophy against the more pragmatic ideas of Saul Alinsky. Peaceful persuasion is the means by which the Indians hope to bring about change while, contrastingly, Alinsky advocates a more direct development of power.

results.title: Encounter with Jupiter
results.creator_credit: Fisher Dilke and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
America’s National Aeronautics and Space Administration’s two robot spacecraft, Voyager 1 & 2 are making remarkable journeys en route through the solar system. Film taken by the two spacecraft are used to relay the findings on the planet Jupiter Edited by Simon Campbell-Jones and narrated by Martin Jarvis
results.description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.

Film taken by the two spacecraft are used to relay the findings on the planet Jupiter Edited by Simon Campbell-Jones and narrated by Martin Jarvis

Episode of Series “Horizon”.
America’s National Aeronautics and Space Administration’s two robot spacecraft, Voyager 1 & 2 are making remarkable journeys en route through the solar system. Film taken by the two spacecraft are used to relay the findings on the planet Jupiter Edited by Simon Campbell-Jones and narrated by Martin Jarvis
